Ye have seen also the breaches of the city of David. The Jews prepared for the war by repairing weaknesses in Jerusalem's walls.

gathered together the waters of the lower pool. The pool refers to Hezekiah's Tunnel, an engineering marvel that was created to permit Jerusalem's inhabitants to safely obtain outside water through the city's walls during a siege. Isaiah selects his terms well; Judah relied on the waters that originated from the ground (Hezekiah's Tunnel) but rejected Jehovah, the "waters of Shiloah that go softly" (8:6) and the "fountain of living waters" (Jer. 2:13; 17:13; Isa. 33:21).
